items.title: Training
items.content: Spend downtime training to gain proficiency in a language or with a tool. Requires 250 days and 1 gp per day, though this time can be reduced if you have a good teacher.
items.example: Learning Thieves' Tools from a guild contact, studying Elvish with a scholar

items.title: Research
items.content: Spend time researching a topic in libraries, archives, or by consulting experts. Make Intelligence checks to uncover information.
items.example: Researching an ancient artifact's history, studying a monster's weaknesses

items.title: Religious Service
items.content: Spend time serving at a temple of your deity. This can earn you favor with religious organizations and potentially divine insight.
items.example: Tending to the sick at a temple of Pelor, transcribing sacred texts

items.title: Skill Advancement
items.content: Use downtime to learn new languages, research arcane lore, or practice unique skills. Results in long-term benefits that later unlock special abilities or opportunities.

items.title: Personal Quests
items.content: Set personal goals based on your character's history, which can be integrated into the broader narrative for unique rewards. Reinforces individual agency and long-term character development.
